original: mdo'i dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: mdo'i dgongs pa ni /

original: 'dir ni 'byung ba rgyu yin te //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'byung ba rgyu yin te //

original: byung ba 'bras bu yin par 'dod //üîΩces gsungs te /
analyzed: byung ba 'bras bu yin par 'dod //üîΩces gsungs te /

analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /

original: 'di las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel bar byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i yan lag ni rten cing 'brel bar byung ba ste /

original: de ltar na yan lag thams cad kyang gnyis kar grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag thams cad kyang gnyis kar grub bo //

original: yang ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /

analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan // ma rig mi mdza' brdzun sogs bzhin //

original: ji ltar mdza' bo las bzlog na //üîΩde'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i mi mdza' ba 'ga' zhig yod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mdza' bo las bzlog na // de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i mi mdza' ba 'ga' zhig yod kyi /

original: mdza' bo las gzhan pa gang yin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mdza' bo las gzhan pa gang yin pa yang ma yin la /

original: mdza' bo med pa yang ma yin pa dang / bden pa zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: mdza' bo med pa yang ma yin pa dang / bden pa zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba ste /
translated: and just as there is a lie, which is the opposite of the truth,üîΩbut is not someone other than the truth,üîΩand is not the absence of the truth,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dag ni mi bden pa yin pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / don @132a * //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dag ni mi bden pa yin pa dang / chos ma yin pa dang / don @132a * //

original: ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa yang chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang rig pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa chos gzhan zhig tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa yang chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang rig pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa chos gzhan zhig tu blta bar bya'o //

original: 'di la gang zhe na /üîΩkun sbyor sogs tshig phyir /
analyzed: 'di la gang zhe na / kun sbyor sogs tshig phyir /

original: mdo dag las /
analyzed: mdo dag las /

original: ma rig pa ni kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas la sogs pa nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas la sogs pa nyid du gsungs te /

original: med pa tsam ni de lta bu yin par 'os pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa tsam ni de lta bu yin par 'os pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The simple negation of knowledge is not that.

original: 'o na ni dper na chung ma ngan ma la chung ma ma yin zhes bya ba dang / bu ngan pa la bu ma yin zhes bya ba ltar ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni dper na chung ma ngan ma la chung ma ma yin zhes bya ba dang / bu ngan pa la bu ma yin zhes bya ba ltar ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //

original: gal te / shes rab ngan po'i min lta phyir //
analyzed: gal te / shes rab ngan po'i min lta phyir //

analyzed: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can yin na de lta na yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas ma rig par mi rung ngo //

original: 'o na ni gang lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de de yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de de yin par 'gyur ro //

original: de yang yin par mi 'os so //
analyzed: de yang yin par mi 'os so //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir //

original: gal te ma rig pa shes rab yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa shes rab yin par 'gyur na /

analyzed: shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir lta ba de dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //

original: shes rab nyon mongs bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs bstan phyir ro //

original: zhes bya ba 'di las kyang 'grub ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di las kyang 'grub ste ;
translated: This is also established by the following.

original: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems ni rnam par mi 'grol lo //

original: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag go zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: shes rab de nyid shes rab de'i nye par nyon mongs pa can du yang mi rigs so ;
translated: It is not tenable that that very wisdom is afflicted by that very wisdom.

original: / yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: / yang ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /

original: gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //

original: ming ni gzugs can min phung po //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can min phung po //

original: tshor ba la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa bzhi'o //

original: skye mched drug ni bshad zin nas //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni bshad zin nas //

original: da ni reg pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni reg pa brjod par bya ste /

original: reg drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: reg drug / mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ro //
translated: They are the contact of eye, etc. up to the contact of mind.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: They are also

original: 'dus te byung ba yin /
analyzed: 'dus te byung ba yin /

analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa las skye'o //
translated: They arise from the coming together of the sense-faculty, the object, and the consciousness.

original: drug po de dag las /
analyzed: drug po de dag las /
translated: Among these six,

analyzed: lnga ni thogs pa'i reg pa yin //

original: drug pa bla dags tshig ces bya //
analyzed: drug pa bla dags tshig ces bya //

original: ming bla dags la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming bla dags la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rig pa'i reg pa ni zag pa med pa'i reg pa'o //

analyzed: yang ma rig pa'i reg pa'i phyogs gcig smos pas /

analyzed: gnod sems rjes su chags pa'i reg / gnod sems rjes su chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang thams cad bsdu na /

analyzed: de la reg pa rnam pa drug sngar bshad zin pa /

analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshor ba drug mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i bar ro //

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: Among them,

original: lnga ni lus kyi'o ;
analyzed: lnga ni lus kyi'o ;

original: / sems kyi gzhan /üîΩlus kyi lnga ste /
analyzed: / sems kyi gzhan / lus kyi lnga ste /

analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir ro // sems kyi ni drug pa ste /

analyzed: de sems tsam la brten pa'i phyir ro // de yid nye bar rgyu ba las //

original: rnam pa dag ni yang bco brgyad //
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni yang bco brgyad //

analyzed: yang sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de nyid yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
translated: The eighteen manopavicƒÅras are established on the basis of the eighteen categories of sensation that arise from the mind.

original: de la yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug go zhes bya ba rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug go zhes bya ba rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yin te / gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //

analyzed: chos la nye bar rgyu ba gsum ni rnam pa gnyis ka yin no //
translated: The three manopavicƒÅras of the dharmas are of both types.

original: yid nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: yid nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression manopavicƒÅra?

original: yid la brten nas yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag yul la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag go //üîΩgzhan dag na re /
analyzed: yid la brten nas yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag yul la nye bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes grag go // gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: yul dag la nye bar rgyu bar byed pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul dag la yang dang yang du rnam par rgyu ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i bar du brjod par bya'o zhe na / 'dod na thams cad rang dmigs can //

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni bco brgyad po thams cad yod la /üîΩde dag thams cad kyi dmigs pa yang de yin no //üîΩde dag nyid kyi /üîΩspyod yul gzugs can bcu gnyis so //

original: rang la dmigs brgyad /

original: gzhan dag ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni med do //

original: de dag / drug gi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de dag / drug gi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The six that have the realm of desire as their object-field

original: 'dod pa'o // 'dod pa'i khams ni drug car gyi yang dmigs pa @133b yin no //üîΩrang ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'o // 'dod pa'i khams ni drug car gyi yang dmigs pa @133b yin no // rang ni bzhi'o //
translated: The realm of desire is the object-field of the six.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni bzhi'i dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni bzhi'i dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The realm of fine-materiality is the object-field of four.

original: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgong ma gcig gi dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir ro // gong ma gcig gi dmigs pa yin //
translated: The realm of fine-materiality is the object-field of four of the above-mentioned six, because odor and taste are absent there.üîΩThe realm of immateriality is the object-field of one.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na dmigs pa yin no //

original: gzugs dang ldan pa dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa dag bshad zin to //
translated: The realms have been discussed.

original: gzugs med nye bar bsdogs na bzhi //üîΩgzugs med pa'i nyer bsngogs ni /
analyzed: gzugs med nye bar bsdogs na bzhi // gzugs med pa'i nyer bsngogs ni /
translated: The preliminary concentration of the realm of immateriality has four.

original: 'dir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs yin te /
translated: The preliminary concentration of the realm of immateriality is the preliminary concentration of the perception-sphere of infinite space.

original: de na ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / reg bya dang / chos la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: de na ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / reg bya dang / chos la nye bar rgyu ba bzhi'o //
translated: There are four investigations: of visible form, sound, tactility and factors.

original: de dag kyang /üîΩgzugs 'gro ; de dag gi dmigs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang / gzugs 'gro ; de dag gi dmigs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin te /
translated: These four investigationsüîΩhave the fourth meditation as their object-field.

original: gang dag gi ltar na de rnam par 'chad pa la dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na de rnam par 'chad pa la dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: According to some, they have the fourth meditation as their object-field when it is in the process of disappearing.

original: gong mar 'gro ba gcig / de na gzugs med pa la dmigs pa ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: gong mar 'gro ba gcig / de na gzugs med pa la dmigs pa ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: One of the higher realms is the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space, which focuses on the formless realm.

original: chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: chos la nye bar rgyu ba'o //
translated: It is the investigation of phenomena.

original: dngos gzhi na gcig gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi na ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na yod kyi gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi na gcig gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi na ni chos la nye bar rgyu ba gcig kho na yod kyi gzhan ni med do //
translated: One of the formless realm is the investigation of phenomena, which is the actual basis of the base of infinite space.

original: de yang / rang yul can /
analyzed: de yang / rang yul can /
translated: It is the basis of its own realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kho na la dmigs pa yin no //üîΩde dag kyang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kho na la dmigs pa yin no // de dag kyang /
translated: It focuses on the formless realm alone.

original: bco brgyad thams cad zag dang bcas //
analyzed: bco brgyad thams cad zag dang bcas //
translated: All eighteen are contaminated.

original: de ltar na tshor ba'i yan lag 'di'i dbye ba ni du ma yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba'i yan lag 'di'i dbye ba ni du ma yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus the classification of the branch of feeling should be understood to be numerous.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni mi brjod de /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni mi brjod de /
translated: The remaining branches are not mentioned.

original: 'di ltar / bshad dang 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan //üîΩ'dir yan lag kha cig ni bshad zin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bshad dang 'chad par 'gyur ba gzhan // 'dir yan lag kha cig ni bshad zin la /
translated: Others will be explained and will be explained.

original: kha cig ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Here some branches have been explained and some will be explained.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de yang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams so zhes bstan pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de yang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams so zhes bstan pa /
translated: It has been taught that dependent origination is the afflictions, karma and the basis.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs sa bon bzhin //
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs sa bon bzhin //
translated: Here, the defilements are like seeds,

original: klu bzhin rtsa bzhin ljon shing bzhin //
analyzed: klu bzhin rtsa bzhin ljon shing bzhin //

original: de bzhin shun pa bzhin du 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin shun pa bzhin du 'dod //

original: dper na sa bon las myu gu dang sdong bu dang lo ma la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na sa bon las myu gu dang sdong bu dang lo ma la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa las kyang nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arise from a seed, so the defilements, actions and the basis arise from the defilements.

original: dper na klu gnas pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: dper na klu gnas pa'i mtsho ni skam par mi 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: Just as a lake inhabited by nagas does not dry up,

original: nyon mongs pa'i klu gnas pa'i skye ba'i mtsho yang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i klu gnas pa'i skye ba'i mtsho yang ngo //
translated: so birth, the lake, does not dry up as long as it is inhabited by the naga of the defilements.

original: dper na nags tshal rtsa ba rnams ma phyung ba rnams ni bcang cing bcad kyang slar skye bar 'gyur ba ltar /
analyzed: dper na nags tshal rtsa ba rnams ma phyung ba rnams ni bcang cing bcad kyang slar skye bar 'gyur ba ltar /
translated: Just as a forest, whose roots have not been pulled up, grows again after it has been cut down,

original: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas ma bton pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas ma bton pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyang ngo //
translated: so the world, whose roots, the defilements, have not been pulled up, grows again after it has been cut down.

original: @134a * // dper na shing ljon pa rnams dus dus su me tog dang 'bras bu rnams skyed par byed pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang lan cig ma yin par nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: @134a * // dper na shing ljon pa rnams dus dus su me tog dang 'bras bu rnams skyed par byed pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang lan cig ma yin par nyon mongs pa dang las dang gzhi rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Just as trees produce flowers and fruits from time to time, so too the defilements are the cause of defilements, actions and sufferings, not only once, but again and again.

original: dper na shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras thug po che rnams skye bar nus pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i shun pa dang bcas pa la skye ba gzhan du skye bar nus so //
analyzed: dper na shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras thug po che rnams skye bar nus pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i shun pa dang bcas pa la skye ba gzhan du skye bar nus so //
translated: Just as grain with its husk is capable of germinating, so too the defilements, when they are accompanied by the husk of the object-field, are capable of producing a new existence.

original: de ltar re zhig nyon mongs pa sa bon dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig nyon mongs pa sa bon dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus the defilements are like a seed.

original: las ni shun bcas 'bras dang 'dra //
analyzed: las ni shun bcas 'bras dang 'dra //
translated: Action is like grain with its husk.

original: de bzhin sman dang me tog bzhin //
analyzed: de bzhin sman dang me tog bzhin //
translated: It is like a medicinal plant and like a flower.

original: shun pa lta bu'i nyon mongs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: shun pa lta bu'i nyon mongs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The defilements are like the husk.

original: da ni shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu'i las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni shun pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu'i las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now we must explain action which is like grain with its husk.

original: dper na 'bru dang sman dag 'bras bu smin na mthar phyin pa de bzhin du las kyang ngo //
analyzed: dper na 'bru dang sman dag 'bras bu smin na mthar phyin pa de bzhin du las kyang ngo //
translated: Just as grain and medicinal plants reach their consummation when the fruit is ripe, so too action.

original: dper na me tog 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la nye ba'i rgyu yin pa ltar las rnams kyang rnam par smin pa bskyed par bya ba la de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na me tog 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la nye ba'i rgyu yin pa ltar las rnams kyang rnam par smin pa bskyed par bya ba la de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the flower is the proximate cause of the fruit, so too is action in regard to the production of the ripened effect.

original: gzhi ni bza' btung grub pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhi ni bza' btung grub pa bzhin //
translated: The basis is like a finished meal.

original: dper na bza' btung du grub pa yongs su longs spyod par bya ba 'ba' zhig yin gyis yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ltar rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bza' btung du grub pa yongs su longs spyod par bya ba 'ba' zhig yin gyis yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ltar rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as a finished meal is only to be enjoyed, not to be made again, so too is the basis called ‚Äúripened effect.‚Äù

original: yang phung po skye ba'i rgyun de sred pa bzhi las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: yang phung po skye ba'i rgyun de sred pa bzhi las mi 'da'o //
translated: The stream of birth of the aggregates does not go beyond the four cravings.

original: srid pa bzhi po de dag las //
analyzed: srid pa bzhi po de dag las //
translated: From among these four existences,

original: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
translated: birth existence is defiled.

original: nyon mongs pa gang gis she na /üîΩrang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs kun //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang gis she na / rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs kun //
translated: By what defilements?üîΩBy all the defilements of its level.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kho nas yin gyi kun nas dkris pa tshig rkya thub pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kho nas yin gyi kun nas dkris pa tshig rkya thub pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is by the defilements themselves, not by the autonomous entanglements.

original: gzhan rnams gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan rnams gsum mo //
translated: The others are of three types.

original: srid pa bar ma la sogs pa ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma la sogs pa ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Intermediate existence and so on are wholesome, unwholesome, and nondefined.

original: de las kyang /
analyzed: de las kyang /
translated: And from that,

original: gzugs med gsum /
analyzed: gzugs med gsum /
translated: three formless states.

original: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs so //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ma gtogs so //
translated: Intermediate existence is excluded.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na srid pa bzhi po yang yod ces bya bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na srid pa bzhi po yang yod ces bya bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the realm of desire and the realm of form, the four modes of existence exist.

original: sems can gyi skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du bshad zin nas /üîΩgnas pa brjod pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du bshad zin nas / gnas pa brjod pa /
translated: The birth of sentient beings has been explained according to the truth of the matter.üîΩNow, the truth of the matter concerning their duration will be explained.

original: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //
translated: Beings endure through food.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: And these foods

original: kham gyi zas la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: kham gyi zas la sogs pa ste //
translated: are the food of morsel, contact,üîΩmental volition, and consciousness.

original: de la / kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
analyzed: de la / kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
translated: The food of morsel is in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni yang med do //
translated: It does not exist in the realm of form or the formless realm.üîΩAnd this food

original: de yang / @134b skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang / @134b skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: is of the nature of three sense-spheres.

original: dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams ni kham gyi zas kho na yin te /
analyzed: dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams ni kham gyi zas kho na yin te /
translated: The sense-spheres of odor, taste, and the tangible are only the food of morsel,

original: kham du byas nas mid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham du byas nas mid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are swallowed after being made into morsels.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin des //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ma yin des //
translated: The sense-sphere of visible form is not food,üîΩbecause it is not swallowed.

original: rang dbang grol la mi phan phyir //
analyzed: rang dbang grol la mi phan phyir //
translated: because it does not benefit those who are liberated and independent.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni kham du byas nas mid pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni kham du byas nas mid pa yin /
translated: The visible form base is food when it is swallowed, having been made into morsels.

original: yang kham gyi zas ma yin te /
analyzed: yang kham gyi zas ma yin te /

original: mid pa'i tshe rang gi dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mid pa'i tshe rang gi dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rnams la phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is swallowed, it does not benefit the faculties and the great elements.

original: gang gi tshe mthong ba na bde ba dang yid bde bar byed pa de'i tshe yang de la dmigs pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zas yin gyi gzugs ma yin no //

translated: When one sees it, it produces pleasure and satisfaction, but at that time, the food is the contact that is the experience of pleasure, not the visible form.

original: grol ba phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zas shin tu yid du 'ong ba mthong ba rnams la yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zas shin tu yid du 'ong ba mthong ba rnams la yang phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //
analyzed: reg dang sems pa rnam shes ni //
translated: Contact, intention, and consciousness

original: zag bcas zas yin gsum dag na //
analyzed: zag bcas zas yin gsum dag na //
translated: are food when they are contaminated.

original: reg pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag kho na zas te /
analyzed: reg pa dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dag kho na zas te /
translated: Contact, intention, and consciousness are food only when they are contaminated.

original: khams gsum char na yang yod do //
analyzed: khams gsum char na yang yod do //
translated: They exist in all three realms.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the uncontaminated not nutriments?

original: 'di ltar srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa gso bar byed pa'i don ni zas kyi don yin na /
translated: Because the meaning of nutriment is to sustain beings,

original: de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin no //
translated: but they are born in order to exhaust existence.

original: gzhan yang mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo las /
translated: Moreover, a sutra states:üîΩThey are beneficial to those who seek existence, who are born, who live, and who sustain themselves.

original: sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / 'tsho bar byed pa dang / srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs na zag pa med pa'i sems rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zas ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / 'tsho bar byed pa dang / srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs na zag pa med pa'i sems rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zas ma yin no //
translated: But uncontaminated minds are not like that, so they are not nutriments.

original: re zhig byung ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams la bya bar yang shes na /
analyzed: re zhig byung ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams la bya bar yang shes na /
translated: We understand that those who are born are sentient beings who have already been born.

original: srid pa tshol ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: But who are those who seek existence?üîΩThose who seek existence are the mind-made,üîΩthose who seek existence,üîΩgandharvas,

original: yid las byung dang srid tshol dang // dri za srid pa bar ma dang // 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yid las byung dang srid tshol dang // dri za srid pa bar ma dang // 'grub pa'o //
translated: and those who are established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa bar ma ni brjod pa 'di dag gis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa bar ma ni brjod pa 'di dag gis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat has stated the intermediate existence with these terms.

original: yid las byung ba ni yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid las byung ba ni yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind-made gods are so called because they are born from the mind alone.

original: srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúseeking existence‚Äù because they are intent on seeking existence.

original: dri za ba'i phyir na dri za'o //
analyzed: dri za ba'i phyir na dri za'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúsmell-eaters‚Äù because they eat odors.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù because they are directed toward birth.

original: yang ci'i phyir zas bzhi kho na yin /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zas bzhi kho na yin /
translated: Why are there only four sustenances?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad srid pa rnams gso bar byad pa dag ma yin @135a * //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad srid pa rnams gso bar byad pa dag ma yin @135a * //
translated: Not all contaminated dharmas sustain the existences.

original: nam zhe na /üîΩde ni de lta yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nam zhe na / de ni de lta yin mod kyi /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'on kyang gtso bor bshad de /üîΩ'di la gnas dang ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bor bshad de / 'di la gnas dang ni /
translated: That is so, but they are explained as primary.

original: brten pa rgyas pa'i don du gnyis //üîΩsrid gzhan 'phen dang 'grub pa yi //
analyzed: brten pa rgyas pa'i don du gnyis // srid gzhan 'phen dang 'grub pa yi //
translated: The two are for the sake of the supportüîΩand the nourished that is based on it.üîΩThe two are for the sake of projecting

original: don du gnyis te go rims bzhin //
analyzed: don du gnyis te go rims bzhin //
translated: and actualizing another existence.

original: gnas ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
analyzed: gnas ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
translated: The support is the body with its faculties.

original: de rgyas par byed pa ni kham gyi zas so //
analyzed: de rgyas par byed pa ni kham gyi zas so //
translated: The nourishment of that is material food.

original: brten pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: brten pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: The nourished is the mind and mental factors.

original: de rgyas par byed pa ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyas par byed pa ni reg pa ste /
translated: Contact nourishes the existence that has already arisen.

original: re zhig 'di gnyis ni 'dir skyes pa'i srid pa gso bar bya ba la gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di gnyis ni 'dir skyes pa'i srid pa gso bar bya ba la gtso bo yin no //
translated: These two are the principal factors in nourishing the existence that has already arisen.

original: yid la sems pas ni yang srid pa 'phen bar byed do //
analyzed: yid la sems pas ni yang srid pa 'phen bar byed do //
translated: Intention projects the new existence.

original: 'phangs zin pa las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par 'grub pas 'di gnyis ni ma skyes pa'i srid pa skyed pa la gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: 'phangs zin pa las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las mngon par 'grub pas 'di gnyis ni ma skyes pa'i srid pa skyed pa la gtso bo yin te /
translated: Consciousness is the seed that is perfumed by action. The new existence is actualized from that seed. These two are the principal factors in producing the existence that has not yet arisen.

original: de'i phyir bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhir gsungs so //

analyzed: sa gang du skyes pa de skyed par byed pa de'i sa pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mthun zin pa'i 'byung las skyes //

original: mi dge ni 'dod @145a * //

analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bkag pa'i phyir thams cad na yod do //

analyzed: de la / gzugs na'ang rnam rig min /

analyzed: rnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //

original: 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med /
analyzed: 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med /

original: gang phyir kun slong med /
analyzed: gang phyir kun slong med /

analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya bas skyed kyi /

analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang 'dod pa'i khams na med do //

analyzed: yang ci kun nas slong ba'i dbang kho na las chos rnams kyi dge ba la sogs par rig par bya'am zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te / 'on kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang ; kun nas slong bas so //

analyzed: de las re zhig thar pa dam pa'i don du dge / mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /

analyzed: de bas na mchog tu bde ba'i phyir don dam par dge ba ste /

analyzed: rtsa ba / ngo tsha khrel yod bdag nyid kyis ;

analyzed: gzhan mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas slong ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'phrod pa'i sman bzhin no //

analyzed: sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba bzhin no //

analyzed: bya ba la sogs kun slong bas //

analyzed: sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las byung ba'i 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: like milk that comes from a cow that has drunk beer.

original: dge ba ji skad du bshad pa de las /
analyzed: dge ba ji skad du bshad pa de las /
translated: The wholesome is the opposite of the unwholesome.

original: bzlog pa mi dge /'khor ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis mchog tu mi bde ba'i phyir don dam par mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa mi dge /'khor ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis mchog tu mi bde ba'i phyir don dam par mi dge ba yin no //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //

analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pas so //

analyzed: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pa dper bya'o //

original: dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not virtuous,

analyzed: don dam par de skad du bshad kyi zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: we explain that it is ultimately so, but that which is contaminated and neutral because it is karmic maturation is called neutral.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can ni dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has pleasant karmic maturation is called virtuous.

original: gal te don dam par lung du ma bstan pa tshol ba na ni de la /
analyzed: gal te don dam par lung du ma bstan pa tshol ba na ni de la /
translated: If you seek that which is neutral ultimately,üîΩthen that which is neutral ultimately is to be analyzed.

original: don dam par lung ma bstan pa brtag pa dag /'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni rnam grangs med par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par lung ma bstan pa brtag pa dag /'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa ni rnam grangs med par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Unconditioned space and nonanalytical cessation are neutral without qualification.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa /

translated: The last volition of the ninth uninterrupted path of detachment from the fourth meditation is the action that is white.üîΩThe other two actions should be understood as being experienced in hell and as being experienced elsewhere in the realm of desire.üîΩThe action that is experienced in hell is black; the action that is experienced elsewhere in the realm of desire is black-white.

original: gzhan ni mthong bas spang bya gnag //
analyzed: gzhan ni mthong bas spang bya gnag //
translated: The action that is to be experienced in the realm of desire is black-white.

original: dge ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The action that is to be experienced in the realm of desire is black-white, because it is not mixed with the wholesome.üîΩThe action that is to be experienced in the realm of desire is black-white, because it is not mixed with the wholesome.

original: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar gnag /'dod pa'i khams la dkar gnag ni bsgom pas spang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa las skyes gzhan dkar gnag /'dod pa'i khams la dkar gnag ni bsgom pas spang ba yin no //
translated: The other actions of the realm of desire are black and white.

original: @156a * // mdo las thub pa'i ni gsum ste zhes gsungs pa de la /üîΩmi slob lus ngag las yid nyid //üîΩthub pa'i gsum ste go rims bzhin //
analyzed: @156a * // mdo las thub pa'i ni gsum ste zhes gsungs pa de la / mi slob lus ngag las yid nyid // thub pa'i gsum ste go rims bzhin //
translated: The S≈´tra says: The Muni has three actions.

original: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni thub pa'i lus dang ngag gi las yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag gi las ni thub pa'i lus dang ngag gi las yin no //
translated: The action of the body and the action of speech of the adept are, respectively, the action of the body and the action of speech of the Muni.

original: mi slob pa'i yid kho na yid kyi thub pa yin te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yid kho na yid kyi thub pa yin te /
translated: The mind of the adept is the mind of the Muni.

original: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi las ni ma yin no //
translated: But the mental action is not the action of the Muni.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩthub pa'i yang spong ba'i don gyis yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / thub pa'i yang spong ba'i don gyis yin te /
translated: Why?

original: de'i phyir yid nyid spong ba la thub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid nyid spong ba la thub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the Muni is so called because he is victorious, and the mind of the adept is victorious.üîΩThe mind of the adept is called the Muni because it is victorious.

original: gtsang byed gsum gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: gtsang byed gsum gsungs pa de la /
translated: The S≈´tra teaches three pure actions.

original: legs spyad gsum po thams cad ni //üîΩgtsang byed rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: legs spyad gsum po thams cad ni // gtsang byed rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: All good conduct is threefold.üîΩAll good conduct of the body, speech and mind is threefold.

original: lus kyi legs par spyad pa thams cad ni lus gtsang byed yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi legs par spyad pa thams cad ni lus gtsang byed yin no //
translated: All good conduct of the body is pure action of the body.

original: de bzhin du ngag dang yid kyi las gtsang ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag dang yid kyi las gtsang ba yin te /

original: lus re zhig dang gtan du nyes par spyad pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus re zhig dang gtan du nyes par spyad pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abandon the defilement of the passions that are bad conduct, for a time and forever.

original: nyes par spyad pa gsum gsungs pa de la /üîΩlus kyi la sogs mi dge ba //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa gsum gsungs pa de la / lus kyi la sogs mi dge ba //
translated: The three kinds of bad conduct have been mentioned.

original: nyes par spyad pa gsum du 'dod //üîΩlus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa gsum du 'dod // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa yin no //
translated: Bad conduct is threefold, consisting of bodily,üîΩverbal, and mental action.

original: brnab sems la sogs las min yang //
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs las min yang //

original: yid kyi nyes spyad rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes spyad rnam gsum mo //
translated: Mental bad conduct is threefold,üîΩconsisting of covetousness, malice, and wrong views,

original: las kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang //
analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang //
translated: even though they are not by nature action.

original: yid kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang log par lta ba'o //
translated: covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: bzlog pa legs par spyad pa yin /
analyzed: bzlog pa legs par spyad pa yin /
translated: Good conduct is the opposite of that.

original: nyes par spyad pa las bzlog pa ni legs par spyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa las bzlog pa ni legs par spyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Good conduct should be understood as the opposite of bad conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa dang legs par spyad pa bshad pa gang dag yin pa /üîΩde las che long bsdus nas ni //üîΩdge dang mi dge ci rigs par //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa dang legs par spyad pa bshad pa gang dag yin pa / de las che long bsdus nas ni // dge dang mi dge ci rigs par //

original: las kyi lam ni bcur gsungs so //
analyzed: las kyi lam ni bcur gsungs so //
translated: The ten paths of action are taught,üîΩaccording to whether they are good or bad,üîΩby summarizing the most important of these.

original: dge ba rnams ni legs par spyad pa dag las so //
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni legs par spyad pa dag las so //
translated: The good ones are the good conducts.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni nyes par spyad pa dag las so //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni nyes par spyad pa dag las so //
translated: The bad ones are the bad conducts.

original: 'dir nyes par spyad pa ci zhig dang / legs par spyad pa ci zhig ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'dir nyes par spyad pa ci zhig dang / legs par spyad pa ci zhig ma bsdus she na /
translated: What bad conduct and what good conduct are not included here?

original: re zhig mi dge ba rnams las lus kyi nyes par spyad pa'i phyogs sbyor ba dang / mjug dang / nyon mongs pa can rdeg pa la sogs pa dang / yid kyi nyes par spyad pa'i phyogs sems pa ma bsdus so //
analyzed: re zhig mi dge ba rnams las lus kyi nyes par spyad pa'i phyogs sbyor ba dang / mjug dang / nyon mongs pa can rdeg pa la sogs pa dang / yid kyi nyes par spyad pa'i phyogs sems pa ma bsdus so //
translated: The bad conduct of body, namely, preparation, conclusion, and the afflicted actions of beating, etc., and the bad conduct of mind, namely, intention, are not included among the bad ones.

original: dge @156b ba la lus kyi legs par spyad pa'i phyogs sbyor ba dang / mjug dang / myos par 'gyur ba la sogs pa spong ba dang / sbyin pa dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa dang / ngag gi nyes par spyad pa yang snyan par smra ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: dge @156b ba la lus kyi legs par spyad pa'i phyogs sbyor ba dang / mjug dang / myos par 'gyur ba la sogs pa spong ba dang / sbyin pa dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa dang / ngag gi nyes par spyad pa yang snyan par smra ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: The virtuous karma is not included in the category of physical good conduct, nor in the category of mental good conduct, nor in the category of mental volition.

original: yid kyi legs par spyad pa'i sems pa ma bsdus so //
analyzed: yid kyi legs par spyad pa'i sems pa ma bsdus so //
translated: The virtuous karma is not included in the category of physical good conduct, nor in the category of mental good conduct, nor in the category of mental volition.

original: las kyi lam de rnams las /
analyzed: las kyi lam de rnams las /
translated: Among those karmic paths,

original: mi dge drug ni rnam rig min //
analyzed: mi dge drug ni rnam rig min //
translated: six nonvirtues are nonindicative.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yems pa las gzhan drug po ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yems pa las gzhan drug po ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: gzhan byed du bcug pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug pa na'o //
translated: When one causes another to commit them,

original: gcig rnams gnyis so //üîΩ'dod pas log par g-yems pa ni rtag tu rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: gcig rnams gnyis so // 'dod pas log par g-yems pa ni rtag tu rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin te /

original: rang nyid kyi de mthar thug par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi de mthar thug par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sexual misconduct is always by nature both indicative and nonindicative form because one brings it to completion oneself.

original: de dag kyang byed na /
analyzed: de dag kyang byed na /
translated: If one causes another to commit them,üîΩone commits one or two karmic paths.

original: las kyi lam drug po 'di dag kyang bdag nyid byed pa na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: las kyi lam drug po 'di dag kyang bdag nyid byed pa na rnam pa gnyis te /

original: rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: indicative action and nonindicative action.

original: dge ba bdun rnam gnyis /
analyzed: dge ba bdun rnam gnyis /

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam par rig byed la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam par rig byed la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //

original: ting 'dzin las skyes rnam rig min //
analyzed: ting 'dzin las skyes rnam rig min //
translated: That arisen from concentration is nonindicative.

original: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa ni sems tsal la rag lus pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o//
analyzed: bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa ni sems tsal la rag lus pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o//
translated: That subsumed by the absorptions and uncontaminated vows is nonindicative action because it is dependent on the mind alone.

original: nyer bsdogs rnams ni rnam rig byed //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs rnams ni rnam rig byed //

original: rnam rig byed min 'gyur ba'am //üîΩma yin / gal te kun nas dkris pa drag po'am /
analyzed: rnam rig byed min 'gyur ba'am // ma yin / gal te kun nas dkris pa drag po'am /
translated: Or they are nonindicative.üîΩIf one engages in the preparatory and subsequent stages with strong entanglement or strong aspiration, they are nonindicative action.

original: rab tu dang ba lhur len pa chen pos sbyor ba rtsom na rnam par rig byed ma yin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba lhur len pa chen pos sbyor ba rtsom na rnam par rig byed ma yin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, they are not.

original: bzlog pa mjug yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa mjug yin no //
translated: The opposite is the conclusion.

original: de dag ni gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ni yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gdon mi za bar rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin ni yin no //
translated: They are necessarily noninformative by nature.

original: rnam par rig byed du ni 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed du ni 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or else, they are informative action.

original: yang na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na ma yin te /
translated: Or else, they are neither.

original: gal te las kyi lam byas nas yang de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod na ni rnam par rig byed du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te las kyi lam byas nas yang de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod na ni rnam par rig byed du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If, after having committed the path of action, one continues to practice the same action, then the path of action is informative action; otherwise, it is noninformative action.

original: mdo las / srog gcod pa ni chags pa las skyes pa dang / zhe sdang las skyes pa dang / gti mug las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba nas log par lta ba'i bar du gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: mdo las / srog gcod pa ni chags pa las skyes pa dang / zhe sdang las skyes pa dang / gti mug las skyes pa'o zhes bya ba nas log par lta ba'i bar du gsungs pa de ni /
translated: The S≈´tra says: Killing that proceeds from attachment, killing that proceeds from hatred, killing that proceeds from delusion...

original: sbyor ba rtsa ba gsum las skyes //üîΩde la srog gcod pa las skyes pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩde'i las kyi yan lag gi phyir @157a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba rtsa ba gsum las skyes // de la srog gcod pa las skyes pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste / de'i las kyi yan lag gi phyir @157a * //

original: ram ; nor gyi phyir ram rtse mo la sogs pa'i phyir sbyor na'o //
analyzed: ram ; nor gyi phyir ram rtse mo la sogs pa'i phyir sbyor na'o //
translated: The preparation of killing that proceeds from attachment is the case where one kills for the sake of another, for wealth, for play, out of passion.

original: zhe sdang las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The preparation of killing that proceeds from hatred is the case where one kills out of hatred.üîΩThe preparation of killing that proceeds from delusion is the case where one kills thinking that, through this killing, one will go to heaven, or that, by killing an old or sick person, one will render him a service.

analyzed: khon las nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir gsod par byed pa'o //

original: gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste mchod sbyin byed pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste mchod sbyin byed pa la sogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: Killing that arises from delusion is, for example, killing for the sake of a sacrifice.

original: ma byin par len pa chags pa las skyes pa'i sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba des de 'phrog pa'am /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa chags pa las skyes pa'i sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang don du gnyer ba des de 'phrog pa'am /

original: gzhan gyi rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnyed pa'am /

analyzed: bkur sti'am grags pa'i phyir ram / bdag gam mdza' bo yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir 'phrog pa'o //

analyzed: zhe sdang las skyes pa ni kho na las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Killing that arises from aversion is in order to protect oneself or one's friends.

original: gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩrgyal pos chos 'don pa po tshad mar byas nas sam /
analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste / rgyal pos chos 'don pa po tshad mar byas nas sam /
translated: Killing that arises from delusion is, for example,üîΩwhen a king kills someone on the basis of the testimony of a witness,

analyzed: mi bgrungs pa chad pas bcad pa'i phyir chos kyi blos 'phrog pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem ba chags pa las skyes ba'i sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi chung ma la sogs pa la chags pas sam ;
translated: Sexual misconduct arising from attachment is the performance of sexual union with someone else‚Äôs spouse and so on out of attachment.üîΩüîΩ

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i phyir mi tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i phyir mi tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Sexual misconduct born of attachment is the practice of sexual intercourse with the wife of another through desire for her, or with one's own wife in an improper place or in an improper manner, or through excessive frequency.

original: zhe sdang las skyes pa ni kho na las nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgti mug las skyes pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: par sig pa rnams ma la sogs pa la bgrod pa'o //

analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa chags pa las skyes pa dang zhe sdang las skyes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Lying, malicious speech and frivolous speech born of attachment and born of hatred are as above.

analyzed: chags pa'i mjug thogs su byung ba ni chags pa las skyes pa rnams so //

original: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //

original: dge ba sbyor dang mjug bcas rnams //
analyzed: dge ba sbyor dang mjug bcas rnams //

original: chags sdang gti mug med las skyes //
analyzed: chags sdang gti mug med las skyes //

translated: All virtuous minds are generated from the three roots because they are motivated by virtuous minds and they are concomitant with nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

analyzed: de mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba spong ba ni dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba yin no // dngos spong ba ni dngos yin no //

original: mjug spong ba ni mjug yin no //
analyzed: mjug spong ba ni mjug yin no //

analyzed: sdom pa len pa na yang sbyor ba dang dngos dang mjug rnams sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: sbyor ba rtsa ba gsum las skyes //

original: zhes bya @157b ba bshad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya @157b ba bshad nas /

analyzed: gang gis gang la mthar thug pa de brjod par bya ste /

original: gsod dang gnod sems tshig rtsub po //
analyzed: gsod dang gnod sems tshig rtsub po //
translated: Killing, malice, and harsh words

original: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin byed //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin byed //
translated: are concluded by hatred.

original: yongs su 'dor ba dang rtsub pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlog g-yems brnab sems ma byin len //
analyzed: yongs su 'dor ba dang rtsub pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // log g-yems brnab sems ma byin len //
translated: because the intention to abandon and the intention to harm are active.üîΩAdultery, covetousness, and stealing are completed by attachment.üîΩAdultery, covetousness, and stealing are completed by attachment.üîΩAdultery is completed by attachment because one is attached to another‚Äôs wife or to sexual pleasure.üîΩCovetousness is completed by attachment because one is attached to another‚Äôs wealth.

original: chags pa yis ni rdzogs par byed //
